description: short +â€Ž fall, from the verb phrase fall short.

entries.meaning: An instance of not meeting a quota, debt, or monthly payment on a debt or other obligation, or of having an insufficient amount to cover such obligations.
examples: Due to a shortfall in revenue, we will have to make some cuts.

entries.meaning: The amount by which a quota, debt, or monthly payment on a debt or other obligation is missed; the difference between the actual quota or debt and the lesser amount available to pay such obligations.
